title_en: A CBSA strike could soon lead to traffic congestion at the border. Here's what you need to know
summary_en:
A strike by employees of the Canadian Border Protection Agency (CBSA) may begin on Thursday.
More than 9,000 CBSA members have been granted permission to strike, including border guards.
Both sides will begin mediation, and the union will be able to strike on June 6.
The union claims that similar actions three years ago "almost stopped commercial cross-border traffic."
The Treasury Board states that 90% of border guards are classified as irreplaceable.
A strike could lead to long queues at the border and hit the economy.
Union members can use the principle of "from work to management", which can slow down the processing of border documents.
The Government faces logistical obstacles to taking action.
The union wants to achieve equal pay with other law enforcement agencies and fill vacancies with permanent employees.

title_en: The union plans to step up action in connection with job cuts at two steel mills in Wales
summary_en:
Union leaders are preparing for mass strikes at two South Wales steel mills.
The plants' actions were planned after threats from the Indian owner, Tata Steel, to cut salaries upon dismissal.
Tata Steel has rejected a union plan aimed at keeping blast furnaces running, putting 2,800 jobs at risk.
The scandal threatens to escalate into a general election issue, with three competing proposals from the Conservatives, trade unions and Labour.
Tata and the conservative government have agreed on a deal providing for the transition to new "eco-friendly" furnaces and reducing emissions into the atmosphere.
Labour has announced its intention to invest 3 billion pounds in the transition to "green steel".
Unite and Labour are preparing to step up strike action in response to the company's threats.

title: –°–ª—É–∂–±–∞, –æ–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞—é—â–∞—è –ø–æ–º–æ—â—å –∂–µ—Ä—Ç–≤–∞–º –≥–µ–Ω–¥–µ—Ä–Ω–æ–≥–æ –Ω–∞—Å–∏–ª–∏—è –≤ –ú–∞–¥—Ä–∏–¥–µ, –±–∞—Å—Ç—É–µ—Ç: "–ì–æ—Ä–æ–¥—Å–∫–æ–π —Å–æ–≤–µ—Ç —Ö–æ—á–µ—Ç, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã —Å–µ—Ç—å –ø–æ–º–æ—â–∏ —É–º–µ—Ä–ª–∞‚Äù
title_en: A service providing assistance to victims of gender-based violence in Madrid is on strike: "The city council wants the aid network to die‚Äù
summary_en:
The Women Workers Platform is calling for a 24-hour strike to condemn the state of the Madrid network for victims of gender-based violence.
Victims face collapse and long waiting times for help.
The workers seek to publicly condemn the conditions in which women receive assistance in the specialized services of the Madrid City Council.
The reasons for victims contacting the protection services include excessive waiting times for the first appointment, staff turnover and long waiting intervals between appointments.
Women condemn institutional violence related to overcrowding of protective premises and uncertainty of access to safe premises.
Female workers stop because of the "limit of what a person can endure in their workplace" combined with terrible economic conditions and constant pressure.
The political leaders of the Madrid City Council are relieving themselves of their duties, demonstrating a lack of interest in the case that claimed the lives of 58 women and more in 2023.
